p: The obtained nucleotide sequences were assembled, edited, and aligned using ChromasProl.33 and BioEdit 7.0. HIV-1 subtyping was performed by constructing the HIV-1 pol phylogenetic tree (MEGA 5.0). The HIVDB Program ( https://hivdb.stanford.edu/hivdb/by-sequences/) from the Stanford HIV Drug Resistance Database was used to analyze the sequences for DRMs [ 16]. Drug resistance was divided into five levels: sensitive, potentially resistant, low resistant, intermediate resistant, and high resistant.
